title: (2) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and is also used
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Insurance Act 1994
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Insurance Act 1994 

(Section 11E(2)) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on 1 October 2020. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited health insurance act 1994 (section 11e(2)) regulation 2020 (2) regulation shall come operation 1 october 2020 interpretation

title: (2) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and is also used
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations, unless the context otherwise requires— 

“Act of 1994” means the Health Insurance Act 1994. 

(2) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and is also used 
in the Act of 1994 shall have in these Regulations the same meaning as it has in 
that Act unless the contrary intention appears. 

(3) A reference in these Regulations— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

to any other enactment shall, unless the context otherwise 
requires, be construed as a reference to that enactment as 
amended or extended by any other enactment, 

a reference to a Regulation is a reference to a Regulation of these 
Regulations unless it is indicated that a reference to some other 
provision is intended, and 

a reference to a Schedule is a reference to a Schedule to these 
Regulations unless it is indicated that a reference to some other 
provision is intended. 

Specification by the Authority
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation unless context otherwise requires-- act 1994 mean health insurance act 1994 (2) word expression used regulation also used act 1994 shall regulation meaning act unless contrary intention appears (3) reference regulations-- (a) (b) (c) enactment shall unless context otherwise requires construed reference enactment amended extended enactment reference regulation reference regulation regulation unless indicated reference provision intended reference schedule reference schedule regulation unless indicated reference provision intended specification authority

title: (2) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and is also used
heading: In accordance with subparagraph (i) of paragraph (b) of subsection (2) of
text_raw:
3. 

In accordance with subparagraph (i) of paragraph (b) of subsection (2) of 
section 11E of the Act of 1994, the Authority specifies that it is satisfied that 
each of the types of relevant contract identified by the product registration 
number specified in column (1) of the Schedule to these Regulations, being 
issued by the registered undertaking specified in column (2) and bearing the 
product name specified in column (3), samples of those types of relevant contract 
having been submitted to the Authority as a new type of relevant contract under 
section 7AB(1) of the Act of 1994, does not provide for advanced cover. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 2nd October, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [378] 3

title: (2) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and is also used
heading: (This note is not part of the Regulations and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Regulations and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations are made by The Health Insurance Authority pursuant to 
Section 11E(2) of the Health Insurance Act 1994, as inserted by section 15 of 
the Health Insurance (Amendment) Act 2012 and specify that The Health 
Insurance Authority is satisfied that certain relevant contracts do not provide for 
advanced cover.
